page.title: 13Women's Institute,Hilmarton.
page.content: The W.I. building is made of corrugated metal and is in the centre of the village. It has two rooms, a meeting room and a room where the toilet and storage areas are.The building has a little garden outside. The W.I. meets on the second Wednesday each month and the annual subscription is Â£4. About 30 women are members of the group and the president is Mrs Ruth Allen. A variety of meetings are organised by the group. In February there was a talk about the history of glass and engraving and in March there was a visit to Wiltshire Radio. In June there was a cookery demonstration and in July there was a visit to a herb garden at Purton Stoke, near Swindon. Apart from meetings the group also organises fund raising and in early June a fete was held.
